wikipedia_page.main: Herbert Heyner (26 June 1882 – 18 January 1954) was a noted English baritone.  Heyner appeared in a handful of operas, and a number of broadcast operas, but his stage appearances were predominantly in oratorio and songs.  He sang in some notable performances of Sir Edward Elgar's oratorios under the composer's baton.  He sang in Britain, France, Germany, the United States and Canada, and he sang at The Proms 59 times between 1909 and 1937, in songs and operatic arias.
